titleStmt.title: Pan his syrinx, or pipe compact of seuen reedes: including in one, seuen tragical and centicall arguments, with their diuers notes not impertinent: Whereby, in effect, of all thinges is touched, in few, something of the vayue, wanton, proud, and unconstant course of the world. Neither herein, to some-what praise-worthie, is prayse vvanting. By William Warner.
titleStmt.author: Warner, William, 1558?-1609.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Thomas Purfoote, and are to be sold at his shop ouergainst Saint Sepulchers church,

notesStmt.note: Copy filmed lacks title page; preliminary pages torn, and signature U2 mutilated. Title taken from British Library copy, spliced at end (beginning-signature D3 and T1-end).
Reproduction of the original in Harvard University. Library.

place.placeName: his shop ouergainst Saint Sepulchers church
